results.title: Birth of a new product
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
Many new products sink without a trace as soon as they are launched on the market. A case history of success and failure shows how the risks can be minimised. Part of a marketing series which highlights, in this film, the market research, the development of new products, advertising, selling and distribution.

results.title: Upbeat in music
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Produced during World War II, this film illustrates the special organisation and arrangments made to provide adequate musical entertainment for troops, both at home and abroad. One particular section deals with the successful fight by the American Federation of Musicians led by James C. Petrillo, to have (in part) royalties paid to a union unemployment fund. Includes such performers as Marian Anderson, George Gershwin, Benny Goodman, Mischa Elman, Serge Koussevitsky, Glenn Miller, Art Tatum, Duke Ellington and Perry Como.

results.title: Search for happiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Shows how the stresses and strains of modern living lead to many unhappy people seeking advice from radio counsellors, newspaper columnists, and fortune tellers.

results.title: Schools march on!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Emphasizes that the public eduction system has been a vital factor in the development of America even though there are many inadequacies in schools of rural communities. Shows how Woodford Country Illinois, successfully solved school problems through proper zooming and consolidation. From the “March of time forum film” series.

results.title: Radio broadcasting today
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Appraises all types of radio programs such as Jack Benny, Toscanini, sport, news etc. The value of quiz programs and soap operas is questioned and other types of programs are commended. Hooper ratings are explained and Lee DeForest appears briefly in the film to decry the misuse of the medium which he helped develop.

results.title: Progress report on Pakistan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas and Pakistani Ambassador Mohammed Ali discuss the development of Pakistan in the five and a half years of its existence as an independent nation and the strategic importance of the famed Khyber Pass. Surveys the industrial and construction programs for modernizing the country, and presents the problem of Kashmir, an area claimed by both Pakistan and India.

results.title: Portugal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A general picture of the Republic of Portugal. Presents Portugal as an example of Catholic social and economic policy. Shows the corporate organization of its society, under dictator Salazar. Gives glimpses of Portugal’s chief exports (Port wine, cork) and its fishing and farming - the greater part of the economy. Shows the education system, which is geared to social stability and respect for the past.

results.title: Our stake in troubled Morocco
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the political unrest in French Morocco which threatens to endanger strategic American air bases in the area. Traces the causes of the dissatisfaction to an awakening nationalism in the Muslim world and to resentment of the country’s colonial status despite improvements initiated by the French government. Shows the everyday life of the people.

results.title: Nobody's children
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: Beginning with the statement that, in the United States, one couple in seven is childless, this film illustrates the demand for children for adoption, describes the procedures followed and shows that the necessary strictness of these has led to one of America’s most pressing social evils - the “black market” in babies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
